snippet: A hearing on the proposal to loosen regulations on spending by unions and advocacy groups was postponed after critics, including Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, denounced the plan.
abstract: New York City Council Speaker Christine Quinn delays action on a bill that would loosen regulations on spending by unions and advocacy groups in New York City elections; after critics, including Mayor Michael R Bloomberg, denounce the measure.
lead_paragraph: A hearing on the proposal to loosen regulations on spending by unions and advocacy groups was postponed after critics, including Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, denounced the plan.

headline.seo: Christine Quinn Delays Action on Campaign Spending Bill
headline.main: Quinn Delays Hearing on Campaign Bill
headline.print_headline: Quinn Delays Hearing on Campaign Bill
